lead_paragraph: The Advertising Club, New York, presented the 2007 International Andy Awards for campaigns that appeared in 2006. For the first time, the Best of Show Award, known as the Grandy, was presented to a digital campaign. The winning agency, R/GA, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, was honored for work for Nike Plus, the running shoe that comes with an iPod Nano. The campaign also won another award, sponsored by Yahoo, called the Big Idea Chair. Offices of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of the TBWA Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, won the most Andys, 14, followed by offices of Leo Burnett Worldwide, part of the Publicis Groupe, with 10. The honor for best in show for public service advertising, known as the Richard T. O’Reilly Award, went to the “Truth” anti-smoking campaign created by Arnold Worldwide, Boston, part of the Arnold Worldwide Partners division of Havas, and Crispin Porter & Bogusky, Miami, part of MDC Partners.

abstract: The balance of power between institutional investors, like Fidelity Investments and T. Rowe Price, and buyout deal makers such as Henry Kravis, David Bonderman and Leon Black, is beginning to shift, says Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: The balance of power between institutional investors, like Fidelity Investments and T. Rowe Price, and buyout deal makers such as Henry Kravis, David Bonderman and Leon Black, is beginning to shift, says Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Are Heavyweight Investors Turning on Private Equity?
